ModelChargeGenerationChargeBlocks.description: Inject a block of charge into the :term:`CCD` detector.

block_start.description: Starting row of the injected charge.

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDeposition.description: Simulate charge deposition by ionizing particles using a stopping power curve.

ehpair_creation.description: the energy required to generate a electron-hole pair in eV by default the Si value at room temperature is parsed i.e. 3.65 eV
ehpair_creation.title: ehpair_creation

energy_mean.description: the mean energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_mean.title: energy_mean

energy_spectrum.description: the location of the file describing the energy spectrum of incident particles if no spectrum is provided energies are randomly drawn from a normal distribution with mean and spread defined above note that the energy spectrum is assumed to be a txt file with two columns [energy, flux] with the energy in MeV
energy_spectrum.title: energy_spectrum

energy_spectrum_sampling.description: "log" or None: the energy spectrum is sampled in log space "linear" : the energy spectrum is sampled in linear space
energy_spectrum_sampling.title: energy_spectrum_sampling

energy_spread.description: the spread in energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_spread.title: energy_spread

flux.description: the flux of incoming particles in particle/s
flux.title: flux

material_density.description: the material density in g/cm3 by default he Si value at room temperature is parsed i.e. 2.3290 g/cm3
material_density.title: material_density

particle_direction.description: "isotropic" : particles are coming from all directions (outside of the sensor) "orthogonal" : particles are coming from the top of the sensor (thickness = 0) and orthogonal to its surface
particle_direction.title: particle_direction

step_size.description: the size of the considered unitary step in unit length along which energy is deposited
step_size.title: step_size

stopping_power_curve.description: the location of the file describing the total massive stopping power energetic loss per mass of material and per unit path length versus particle energy note that the the stopping power curve is assumed to be a csv file with two columns [energy, stopping power] energy in MeV, stopping power in MeV cm2/g
stopping_power_curve.title: stopping_power_curve

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDeposition.title: Model 'charge_deposition'

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDepositionInM.description: Simulate charge deposition by ionizing particles using a stopping power curve.

cutoff_wavelength.description: the longest wavelength in micrometer at which the QE reaches 50% of its maximum, used to compute the bandgap energy, and the corresponding fraction of cadmium
cutoff_wavelength.title: cutoff_wavelength

energy_mean.description: the mean energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_mean.title: energy_mean

energy_spectrum.description: the location of the file describing the energy spectrum of incident particles if no spectrum is provided energies are randomly drawn from a normal distribution with mean and spread defined above note that the energy spectrum is assumed to be a txt file with two columns [energy, flux] with the energy in MeV
energy_spectrum.title: energy_spectrum

energy_spectrum_sampling.description: "log" : the energy spectrum is sampled in log space "linear" : the energy spectrum is sampled in linear space
energy_spectrum_sampling.title: energy_spectrum_sampling

energy_spread.description: the spread in energy of the incoming ionizing particles in MeV
energy_spread.title: energy_spread

flux.description: the flux of incoming particles in particle/s
flux.title: flux

particle_direction.description: "isotropic" : particles are coming from all directions (outside of the sensor) "orthogonal" : particles are coming from the top of the sensor (thickness = 0) and orthogonal to its surface
particle_direction.title: particle_direction

step_size.description: the size of the considered unitary step in unit length along which energy is deposited
step_size.title: step_size

stopping_power_curve.description: the location of the file describing the total massive stopping power energetic loss per mass of material and per unit path length versus particle energy note that the the stopping power curve is assumed to be a csv file with two columns [energy, stopping power] energy in MeV, stopping power in MeV cm2/g
stopping_power_curve.title: stopping_power_curve

ModelChargeGenerationChargeDepositionInM.title: Model 'charge_deposition_in_mct'

ModelChargeGenerationConversionWith3dQeM.description: Generate charge from incident photon via photoelectric effect.
ModelChargeGenerationConversionWith3dQeM.title: Model 'conversion_with_3d_qe_map'

ModelChargeGenerationConversionWithQeMap.description: Generate charge from incident photon via photoelectric effect, simple model with custom :term:`QE` map.

align.description: Keyword to align the :term:`QE` map to detector. Can be any from: ("center", "top_left", "top_right", "bottom_left", "bottom_right")
align.title: align

position.description: Indices of starting row and column, used when fitting :term:`QE` map to detector.
position.title: position

ModelChargeGenerationConversionWithQeMap.title: Model 'conversion_with_qe_map'

initial_energy.description: Kinetic energy of particle, set `random` for random.
initial_energy.title: initial_energy

ionization_energy.description: Mean ionization energy of the semiconductor lattice.
ionization_energy.title: ionization_energy

stepsize.description: Define the different step sizes. Only for running mode 'stepsize'
stepsize.title: stepsize

ModelChargeGenerationDarkCurrent.description: Add dark current to the detector charge.

band_gap.description: Semiconductor band_gap. If none, the one for silicon is used. Unit: eV
band_gap.title: band_gap

band_gap_room_temperature.description: Semiconductor band gap at 300K. If none, the one for silicon is used. Unit: eV
band_gap_room_temperature.title: band_gap_room_temperature

figure_of_merit.description: Dark current figure of merit. Unit: nA/cm^2
figure_of_merit.title: figure_of_merit

spatial_noise_factor.description: Dark current fixed pattern noise factor.
spatial_noise_factor.title: spatial_noise_factor

ModelChargeGenerationDarkCurrent.title: Model 'dark_current'

ModelChargeGenerationDarkCurrentRule07.description: Generate charge from dark current process based on the Rule07 model.

cutoff_wavelength.description: The wavelength cut-off for the detector (default is 2.5 µm). Unit: µm
cutoff_wavelength.title: cutoff_wavelength

seed.description: Seed for random number generation to allow reproducibility of noise patterns.
seed.title: seed

spatial_noise_factor.description: Factor for introducing spatial noise (fixed pattern noise) in the dark current.
spatial_noise_factor.title: spatial_noise_factor

temporal_noise.description: If True, shot noise (Poisson noise) is added to the dark current.
temporal_noise.title: temporal_noise

ModelChargeGenerationDarkCurrentRule07.title: Model 'dark_current_rule07'

ModelChargeGenerationDarkCurrentSaphira.description: Simulate dark current in a Saphira APD detector.
ModelChargeGenerationDarkCurrentSaphira.title: Model 'dark_current_saphira'

ModelChargeGenerationExponentialQe.description: Apply QE with temperature correction for absorptivity using a provided or backup coefficient `c`.

default_wavelength.description: Wavelength in nm for 2D photon arrays, or 'multi' for multiple wavelengths (no default value).
default_wavelength.title: default_wavelength

detector_type.description: Type of detector ("BI" for Back-Illuminated, "FI" for Front-Illuminated).
detector_type.title: detector_type

filename.description: Path to the CSV file containing reflectivity, absorptivity, and c.
filename.title: filename

name.description: Name to use for the result.
name.title: name

x_epi.description: Thickness of the epitaxial layer in cm.
x_epi.title: x_epi

x_poly.description: Thickness of the poly layer in cm.
x_poly.title: x_poly

ModelChargeGenerationExponentialQe.title: Model 'exponential_qe'

align.title: align

position.description: Indices of starting row and column, used when fitting charge to detector.
position.title: position

time_scale.description: Time scale of the input charge, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

ModelChargeGenerationRadiationInducedDar.description: Model to add dark current induced by radiation to the detector charge.
ModelChargeGenerationRadiationInducedDar.title: Model 'radiation_induced_dark_current'

ModelChargeGenerationSimpleConversion.description: Generate charge from incident photon via photoelectric effect, simple model.
ModelChargeGenerationSimpleConversion.title: Model 'simple_conversion'

ModelChargeGenerationSimpleDarkCurrent.description: Simulate dark current in a detector.

dark_rate.description: Dark current, in e⁻/pixel/second, which is the way manufacturers typically report it.
dark_rate.title: dark_rate

ModelChargeGenerationSimpleDarkCurrent.title: Model 'simple_dark_current'

ModelChargeMeasurementAcCrosstalk.description: Apply AC crosstalk signal to detector signal.

channel_matrix.description: Mapping from pixel positions to amplifier channels. If not provided it is taken from the detector geometry.
channel_matrix.title: channel_matrix

coupling_matrix.description: 2D matrix defining the signal coupling between amplifier channels. Can be a filename (to be loaded) or directly an array.
coupling_matrix.title: coupling_matrix

readout_directions.description: Array indicating the readout direction per channel. If not provided it is taken from the detector geometry.
readout_directions.title: readout_directions

ModelChargeMeasurementDcCrosstalk.description: Apply DC crosstalk signal to detector signal.

channel_matrix.description: Mapping from pixel positions to amplifier channels. If not provided it is taken from the detector geometry.
channel_matrix.title: channel_matrix

coupling_matrix.description: 2D matrix defining the signal coupling between amplifier channels. Can be a filename (to be loaded) or directly an array.
coupling_matrix.title: coupling_matrix

readout_directions.description: Array indicating the readout direction per channel. If not provided it is taken from the detector geometry.
readout_directions.title: readout_directions

ModelChargeMeasurementKtcNoise.description: Apply KTC reset noise to detector signal array.
ModelChargeMeasurementKtcNoise.title: Model 'ktc_noise'

ModelChargeMeasurementNghxrg.description: Generate fourier noise power spectrum on HXRG detector.

n_frame_overhead.description: New frame overhead in rows. This allows for a short wait at the end of a frame before starting the next frame.
n_frame_overhead.title: n_frame_overhead

n_row_overhead.description: New row overhead in pixel. This allows for a short wait at the end of a row before starting the next row.
n_row_overhead.title: n_row_overhead

reference_pixel_border_width.description: Width of reference pixel border around image area.
reference_pixel_border_width.title: reference_pixel_border_width

reverse_scan_direction.description: Set this True to reverse the fast scanner readout directions. This capability was added to support Teledyne’s programmable fast scan readout directions. The default setting (False) corresponds to what HxRG detectors default to upon power up.
reverse_scan_direction.title: reverse_scan_direction

ModelChargeMeasurementOutputNodeNoise.description: Add noise to signal array of detector output node using normal random distribution.

ModelChargeMeasurementOutputNodeNoiseCmo.description: Output node noise model for :term:`CMOS` detectors where readout is statistically independent for each pixel.

readout_noise_std.description: Readout noise standard deviation in units of electrons. Unit: electron

d_implant.title: d_implant

gain.description: Gain to apply. By default, this is the sensitivity of charge readout. Unit: V/e-
gain.title: gain

ModelChargeTransferArcticAdd.description: Add :term:`CTI` trails to an image by trapping, releasing and moving electrons.

express.description: As described in more detail in :cite:p:`2014:massey` section 2.1.5, the effects of each individual pixel-to-pixel transfer can be very similar, so multiple transfers can be computed at once for efficiency. The ``express`` input sets the number of times the transfers are calculated.  * ``express = 1`` is the fastest and least accurate. * ``express = 2`` means the transfers are re-computed half-way through readout. * ``express = N`` where ``N`` is the total number of pixels.  Default ``express = 0`` is a convenient input for automatic ``express = N``.
express.title: express

trap_densities.description: A 1D arrays of all trap species densities for serial clocking.
trap_densities.title: trap_densities

trap_release_timescales.description: A 1D arrays of all trap release timescales for serial clocking.
trap_release_timescales.title: trap_release_timescales

ModelChargeTransferArcticAdd.title: Model 'arctic_add'

ModelChargeTransferArcticRemove.description: Remove :term:`CTI` trails from an image by first modelling the addition of :term:`CTI`.

express.description: As described in more detail in :cite:p:`2014:massey` section 2.1.5, the effects of each individual pixel-to-pixel transfer can be very similar, so multiple transfers can be computed at once for efficiency. The ``express`` input sets the number of times the transfers are calculated.  * ``express = 1`` is the fastest and least accurate. * ``express = 2`` means the transfers are re-computed half-way through readout. * ``express = N`` where ``N`` is the total number of pixels.  Default ``express = 0`` is a convenient input for automatic ``express = N``.
express.title: express

num_iterations.description: Number of iterations for the forward modelling. More iterations provide higher accuracy at the cost of longer runtime. In practice, just 1 to 3 iterations are usually sufficient.
num_iterations.title: num_iterations

ModelChargeTransferArcticRemove.title: Model 'arctic_remove'

charge_injection.description: Enable charge injection (only used in ``"parallel"`` mode).
charge_injection.title: charge_injection

direction.description: Set ``"parallel"`` for :term:`CTI` in parallel direction or ``"serial"`` for :term:`CTI` in serial register.
direction.title: direction

electron_effective_mass.description: Electron effective mass in the semiconductor lattice. Unit: 1 electron mass
electron_effective_mass.title: electron_effective_mass

max_electron_volume.description: Maximum geometrical volume :math:`V_g` that electrons can occupy within a pixel. Unit: :math:`cm^3`.
max_electron_volume.title: max_electron_volume

ModelChargeTransferMultiplicationRegiste.description: Calculate total gain of image with EMCCD multiplication register.

gain_elements.description: Amount of single stage gain elements in the EMCCD register.
gain_elements.title: gain_elements

ModelChargeTransferMultiplicationRegiste.title: Model 'multiplication_register'

ModelChargeTransferMultiplicationRegiste.description: Calculate total gain of image with EMCCD multiplication register.

gain_elements.description: Amount of single stage gain elements in the EMCCD register.
gain_elements.title: gain_elements

ModelChargeTransferMultiplicationRegiste.title: Model 'multiplication_register_cic'

thresh.description: Threshold pixel value above which information from the image array is extracted
thresh.title: thresh

name.description: Name to use for the result.

name.description: Name to use for the result.
name.title: name

ModelDataProcessingRemoveCosmicRays.description: Extract the roi data converts it to xarray dataset and saves the information to the final result.

contrast.description: Contrast threshold between the Laplacian image and the fine-structure image.
contrast.title: contrast

cr_threshold.description: The Laplacian signal-to-noise ratio threshold for cosmic-ray detection.
cr_threshold.title: cr_threshold

effective_gain.description: Ratio of counts (e.g., electrons or photons) to the units of data.
effective_gain.title: effective_gain

neighbor_threshold.description: The Laplacian signal-to-noise ratio threshold for detection of cosmic rays in pixels neighboring the initially-identified cosmic rays.

readnoise.description: The read noise (in electrons) in the input data.

data_structure.description: Keyword to choose data structure. Can be any from: ("pixel", "photon", "signal", "image", "all"). Default is "signal" and computes the SNR on "signal".
data_structure.title: data_structure

ModelDataProcessingSignalToNoiseRatio.title: Model 'signal_to_noise_ratio'

ModelDataProcessingSourceExtractor.description: Extract the roi data converts it to xarray dataset and saves the information to the final result.

minarea.description: Minimum area of pixels required that are above the threshold for the extractor to extract information
minarea.title: minarea

thresh.description: Threshold pixel value above which information from the image array is extracted
thresh.title: thresh

ModelDataProcessingSourceExtractor.title: Model 'source_extractor'

data_structure.description: Keyword to choose data structure. Can be any from: ("pixel", "photon", "signal", "image", "all"). Default is "all" and computes the statistics on "pixel", "photon", "signal" and "image".
data_structure.title: data_structure

scaling_factor.description: Scaling factor taking into account the missing pieces of superconducting physics, as well as the resonator quality factor, the bias power, the quasi-particle losses, etc.
scaling_factor.title: scaling_factor

t_c.description: Material dependent critical temperature. Unit: K
t_c.title: t_c

ModelPhotonCollectionIllumination.description: Generate photon uniformly over the entire array or over an elliptic or rectangular object.

object_center.description: List or tuple of length 2, two integers (row and column number), defining the coordinates of the center of the elliptic or rectangular object.
object_center.title: object_center

object_size.description: List or tuple of length 2, integers defining the diameters of the elliptic or rectangular object in vertical and horizontal directions.
object_size.title: object_size

option.description: A string indicating the type of illumination:  - ``uniform``: Uniformly fill the entire array with photon. (Default) - ``elliptic``: Mask with elliptic object. - ``rectangular``: Mask with rectangular object.
option.title: option

time_scale.description: Time scale of the photon flux, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

ModelPhotonCollectionIllumination.title: Model 'illumination'

ModelPhotonCollectionLoadImage.description: Load :term:`FITS` file as a numpy array and add to the detector as input image.

align.description: Keyword to align the image to detector. Can be any from: ("center", "top_left", "top_right", "bottom_left", "bottom_right")
align.title: align

bit_resolution.description: Bit resolution of the loaded image.
bit_resolution.title: bit_resolution

convert_to_photons.description: If ``True``, the model converts the values of loaded image array from ADU to photon numbers for each pixel using the Photon Transfer Function: :math:`\mathit{PTF} = \mathit{quantum\_efficiency} \cdot \mathit{charge\_to\_voltage\_conversion} \cdot \mathit{pre\_amplification} \cdot \mathit{adc\_factor}`.
convert_to_photons.title: convert_to_photons

header_section_index.description: Section index or name of the header data to load if `include_header` is enabled. This parameter is provisional and may be removed.
header_section_index.title: header_section_index

include_header.description: If ``True``, extract header metadata from the image file. This parameter is provisional and may be removed.
include_header.title: include_header

multiplier.description: Multiply photon array level with a custom number.
multiplier.title: multiplier

position.description: Indices of starting row and column, used when fitting image to detector.
position.title: position

time_scale.description: Time scale of the photon flux, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

ModelPhotonCollectionLoadImage.title: Model 'load_image'

filename.description: Input filename of the point spread function.
filename.title: filename

ModelPhotonCollectionLoadPsf.title: Model 'load_psf'

ModelPhotonCollectionLoadWavelengthPsf.description: Read psf files depending on simulation and instrument parameters.

filename.description: Input filename of the point spread function.
filename.title: filename

wavelength_col.description: Dimension name in the file that contains the wavelength information.
wavelength_col.title: wavelength_col

wavelength_table_name.description: Column name in the file that contains the wavelength information.
wavelength_table_name.title: wavelength_table_name

x_col.description: Dimension name in the file that contains the x information.
x_col.title: x_col

y_col.description: Dimension name in the file that contains the y information.
y_col.title: y_col

ModelPhotonCollectionLoadWavelengthPsf.title: Model 'load_wavelength_psf'

ModelPhotonCollectionOpticalPsf.description: Model function for poppy optics model: convolve photon array with psf.

apply_jitter.description: Defines whether jitter should be applied, default is False.
apply_jitter.title: apply_jitter

extract_psf.description: Copy the computed PSF into the data bucket ``detector.data['/photon_collection/optical_psf/[name of the model]/psf']``
extract_psf.title: extract_psf

fov_arcsec.description: Field Of View on detector plane in arcsec.
fov_arcsec.title: fov_arcsec

jitter_sigma.description: Jitter sigma value in arcsec per axis, default is 0.007.
jitter_sigma.title: jitter_sigma

optical_system.description: List of optical elements before detector with their specific arguments.
optical_system.title: optical_system

pixel_scale.description: Pixel scale of detector in arcsec/pix.
pixel_scale.title: pixel_scale

wavelength.description: Wavelength of incoming light in meters, default is None.
wavelength.title: wavelength

ModelPhotonCollectionOpticalPsf.title: Model 'optical_psf'

ModelPhotonCollectionShotNoise.description: Add shot noise to the flux of photon per pixel. It can be either Poisson noise or Gaussian.

type.description: Choose either 'poisson' or 'normal'. Default is Poisson noise.
type.title: type

ModelPhotonCollectionShotNoise.title: Model 'shot_noise'

ModelPhotonCollectionSimpleCollection.description: Convert scene in ph/(cm2 nm s) to photon in ph/nm s or ph s.

aperture.description: Collecting area of the telescope. Unit: m.
aperture.title: aperture

filter_band.description: Wavelength range of selected filter band, default is None. Unit: nm.
filter_band.title: filter_band

integrate_wavelength.description: If true, integrates along the wavelength else multiwavelength, default is True.
integrate_wavelength.title: integrate_wavelength

pixel_scale.description: Pixel scale of detector, default is None. Unit: arcsec/pixel.
pixel_scale.title: pixel_scale

resolution.description: Resolution of provided wavelength range in filter band. Unit: nm.
resolution.title: resolution

ModelPhotonCollectionSimpleCollection.title: Model 'simple_collection'

angle.description: Angle of the pattern in degrees.
angle.title: angle

period.description: Period of the periodic pattern in pixels.
period.title: period

startwith.description: 1 to start with high level or 0 for 0.
startwith.title: startwith

time_scale.description: Time scale of the photon flux, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

align.description: Keyword to align the image to detector. Can be any from: ("center", "top_left", "top_right", "bottom_left", "bottom_right")
align.title: align

bit_resolution.description: Bit resolution of the loaded image.
bit_resolution.title: bit_resolution

convert_to_photons.description: If ``True``, the model converts the values of loaded image array from ADU to photon numbers for each pixel using the Photon Transfer Function: :math:`\mathit{PTF} = \mathit{quantum\_efficiency} \cdot \mathit{charge\_to\_voltage\_conversion} \cdot \mathit{pre\_amplification} \cdot \mathit{adc\_factor}`.
convert_to_photons.title: convert_to_photons

multiplier.description: Multiply photon array level with a custom number.
multiplier.title: multiplier

position.description: Indices of starting row and column, used when fitting image to detector.
position.title: position

time_scale.description: Time scale of the photon flux, default is 1 second. 0.001 would be ms.
time_scale.title: time_scale

ModelPhotonCollectionWavelengthDependenc.description: Generate the photon over the array according to a specific dispersion pattern (ARIEL-AIRS).

psf_filename.description: The location and the filename where the PSFs are located.
psf_filename.title: psf_filename

target_filename.description: The location and the filename of the target file used in the simulation.
target_filename.title: target_filename

telescope_diameter_m1.description: Diameter of the M1 mirror of the TA in m.
telescope_diameter_m1.title: telescope_diameter_m1

telescope_diameter_m2.description: Diameter of the M2 mirror of the TA in m.
telescope_diameter_m2.title: telescope_diameter_m2

ModelPhotonCollectionWavelengthDependenc.title: Model 'wavelength_dependence_airs'

n_0.description: Material dependent single spin density of states at the Fermi-level. Unit: um^-3 eV^-1
n_0.title: n_0

t_c.description: Material dependent critical temperature. Unit: K
t_c.title: t_c

tau_0.description: Material dependent characteristic time for the electron-phonon coupling. Unit: s
tau_0.title: tau_0

ModelReadoutElectronicsSarAdc.description: Digitize signal array using :term:`SAR` (Successive Approximation Register) :term:`ADC` logic.
ModelReadoutElectronicsSarAdc.title: Model 'sar_adc'

ModelReadoutElectronicsSarAdcWithNoise.description: Digitize signal array using :term:`SAR` (Successive Approximation Register) :term:`ADC` logic with noise.
ModelReadoutElectronicsSarAdcWithNoise.title: Model 'sar_adc_with_noise'

ModelReadoutElectronicsSimpleAdc.description: Apply simple Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) to the `signal` bucket from `Detector`.

data_type.description: The desired data-type for the Image array. The data-type must be an unsigned integer. If not provided, the data type is determined based on `detector.characteristics.adc_bit_resolution`. Valid values: 'uint8', 'uint16', 'uint32', 'uint64' Invalid values: 'int16', 'int32', 'int64', 'int', 'float'...
data_type.title: data_type

ModelReadoutElectronicsSimpleAdc.title: Model 'simple_adc'

ModelReadoutElectronicsSimpleAmplifier.description: Amplify signal using gain from the output amplifier and the signal processor.
ModelReadoutElectronicsSimpleAmplifier.title: Model 'simple_amplifier'

ModelReadoutElectronicsSimplePhaseConver.description: Create an image array from phase array.
ModelReadoutElectronicsSimplePhaseConver.title: Model 'simple_phase_conversion'

ModelSceneGenerationLoadStarMap.description: Generate scene from scopesim Source object loading stars from the GAIA catalog.

band.description: Define the band to use. Available values:  * 'blue_photometer' is the band from 330 nm to 680 nm * 'gaia_band' is the band from 330 nm to 1050 nm * 'red_photometer' is the band from 640 nm to 1050 nm
band.title: band

with_caching.description: Enable/Disable caching request to GAIA catalog.
with_caching.title: with_caching

ModelSceneGenerationLoadStarMap.title: Model 'load_star_map'
